Hero.name: Le Nam Tuyen
Hero.role: Product Manager & Data Analyst candidate in FinTech
Hero.quote: Transforming vision into reality, turning intent into results.

About.title: About Me
About.description: Final-year Financial Technology student at the University of Economics and Law (VNU-HCM), focused on product development, data analysis, and evidence-based decision making. Design and deliver practical workshops on product discovery, user research, SQL, Python, dashboards, experiment evaluation, and product analytics. In cross-functional settings, convert insights into clear product requirements, establish success metrics, and implement lean experiments to enhance user experience and business outcomes. Proficient in Python, SQL, and modern BI platforms; build scalable templates and reporting systems to improve execution quality and velocity. Seeking a Data Analyst or Associate PM role in FinTech to translate data and customer insights into measurable product impact.

Certifications.title: Certificates & Awards
Certifications.googleCert: Google Certificate – Ask Questions to Make Data-Driven Decisions
Certifications.nvidiaCert: NVIDIA Certificate – Accelerating End-to-End Data Science Workflows
Certifications.journalArticle: Journal Article – Public Debt and Economic Stability, the Moderating Effect of Governance: Evidence from SEA Countries

achievements: Applied data-driven market analysis to clean, visualize, and interpret trading data for listed tickers.
Performed financial analysis and equity valuation; prepared concise investment briefs to support trade ideas.
Authored daily/weekly market reports for the Senior Broker to inform client outreach and portfolio actions.
Supported client development by screening prospects, assembling pitch materials, and monitoring portfolios.
Built an automated stock-advisory chatbot that aggregated daily news and surfaced ticker-level insights, improving team efficiency and responsiveness.
Produced timely market reports covering sector and macroeconomic updates to support lending decisions.
Developed capital-utilization proposals for corporate clients (working capital, capex, facility mix), including cash-flow modeling and scenario analysis.
Performed credit risk assessments and drafted loan recommendations by analyzing business models, collateral, and repayment capacity.
Conducted financial statement analysis with ratio and trend analysis to inform underwriting.

automatedReport.name: Automated Financial Report Export
description: Built an end-to-end Python pipeline (individual) for stock-ticker analytics: ingesting raw API data with environment-managed secrets, producing standardized daily reports in Excel, CSV, and PDF formats.

Implemented with requests, pandas, python-dotenv; modularized into fetch • process • report components with reusable helpers for path management, API key loading, validation, and date handling; scheduled via cron.
Results: reduced manual preparation time by 90%, improved team responsiveness by 25%.

airbnbPredictor.name: Airbnb rental pricing predictor
description: Cleaned and engineered a 26,000-row Airbnb dataset (individual): converting currencies to numeric, parsing dates, trimming outliers at the 99.5th percentile, building a pricing workflow with standardized inputs and outputs.

Built a full preprocessing and modeling pipeline in scikit-learn: ColumnTransformer, StandardScaler, OneHotEncoder, Linear Regression, Random Forest, stratified sampling by city, GridSearchCV for tuning.

Delivered client-ready insights with feature importance highlighting accommodates, bathrooms, bedrooms, beds, and fees as key drivers; achieved test RMSE = 95.84 and MAE = 57.98 using tuned Random Forest (~4% error reduction versus linear baseline); example predicted price 834.20 for a Bondi Beach home.

hrAnalytics.name: Workforce Insight Hub: Retention and Compensation
description: Built an end-to-end HR analytics workflow (individual): cleaning and encoding Human_Resources.csv, conducting EDA with histograms, KDE, boxplots, and correlation heatmap to surface retention risks.

Trained a Random Forest attrition model and Logistic Regression for interpretability; achieved 85% accuracy with key drivers including MonthlyIncome, Age, OverTime, TotalWorkingYears, DailyRate; noted low recall on leavers = 0.07.
Segmented employees into 3 clusters using MonthlyIncome, TotalWorkingYears, YearsAtCompany, JobSatisfaction; delivered salary and overtime policy recommendations based on 16.1% attrition rate.
